tit.cmt: (commander of cavalry) を追記しました。

sen.j: 騎兵大将軍(きへいたいしょうぐん)とは、奈良時代、日本の律令制において設置された武官。
sen.e: Kihei Taishogun was a military official established in the Nara period under the ritsuryo penal and administrative system.
Kihei Taishogun was a military official established in the Nara period under the ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: the ritsuryo penal and administrative system の penal and administrative を削除しました。
sen.e: Kihei Taishogun was a military official established in the Nara period under the ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 外国の使臣入京や天皇行幸の列などの威儀を張るため、または警衛のために諸国より徴発された騎兵を率いる指揮官のこと。
sen.e: It was a commander to head cavalrymen who were conscripted throughout Japan, and led the cavalry to escort and dignify the entrance of foreign envoy or emperor's procession.
Kihei Taishogun was a commander to head cavalrymen who were conscripted throughout Japan, and led the cavalry to escort and dignify the entrance of foreign envoy or Imperial visit.
sen.cmt: It を Kihei Taishogun に修正しました。emperor's procession を Imperial visit に修正しました。
sen.e: Kihei Taishogun was a commander to head cavalrymen who were conscripted throughout Japan, and led the cavalry to escort and dignify the entrance of foreign envoy or Imperial visit.

sen.cmt: 文頭に It is を追記しました。

sen.j: 騎兵大将軍は『続日本紀』の慶雲2年(705年)11月乙丑条の新羅使を迎えた迎えた際に、紀古麻呂を任じたのが初見であり、天平12年(740年)に藤原広嗣が九州で謀叛した藤原広嗣の乱において、聖武天皇が伊賀国、伊勢国に行幸した際、藤原仲麻呂を前騎兵大将軍、紀麻路を後騎兵大将軍に任じ、400もの騎兵に警衛させたことが記録されている。
sen.e: Kihei Taishogun first appeared in "Shoku Nihongi" entry dated the eleventh month, the day of Kinoto-Ushi in 705, when KI no Komaro was appointed Kihei Taishogun to meet and escort the Shilla envoy; It was also recorded that when FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu raised the army in Kyushu against the throne in 740 (Fujiwara Hirotsugu Uprising), Emperor Shomu went to Iga and Ise provinces with FUJIWARA no Nakamaro as Zen Kihei Taishogun and KI no Maro as Go Kihei Taishogun, guarded by 400 cavalrymen.

Kihei Taishogun first appeared in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) entry dated the eleventh month, the day of Kinoto-Ushi in 705, when KI no Komaro was appointed Kihei Taishogun to meet and escort the Shilla envoy; it was also recorded that when FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu raised the army in Kyushu against the throne at the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu in 740, Emperor Shomu went to Iga and Ise Provinces with FUJIWARA no Nakamaro as Zen (front) Kihei Taishogun and KI no Maro as Go (rear) Kihei Taishogun, guarded by 400 cavalrymen.

Kihei Taishogun first appeared in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) entry dated the eleventh month, the day of Kinoto-Ushi in 705, when KI no Komaro was appointed Kihei Taishogun to meet and escort the Shilla envoy; it was also recorded that when FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu raised the army in Kyushu against the throne at the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu in 740, Emperor Shomu went to Iga and Ise Provinces with FUJIWARA no Nakamaro as Zen (front) Kihei Taishogun and KI no Maro as Go (rear) Kihei Taishogun, guarded by 400 cavalrymen.

sen.j: 天平神護元年(765年)、称徳天皇が河内国弓削に行幸した際には、藤原縄麻呂、百済王敬福を各騎兵大将軍に任じた。
sen.e: When Emperor Shotoku visited Yuge, Kawachi province in 765, FUJIWARA no Tadamaro and Kudaranokonikishi Kyofuku were appointed respective Kihei Taishogun.
When Emperor Shotoku visited Yuge, Kawachi Province in 765, FUJIWARA no Tadamaro and Kyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI were appointed respective Kihei Taishogun.
sen.cmt: province を Province に修正しました。Kudaranokonikishi Kyofuku をKyofuku KUDARANOKONIKISHI に修正しました。
